posts.title: Georgia become second US state to shield maker of Roundup weed killer from some cancer claims
top_comments: FYI, the other state is North Dakota

>Bayer insists glyphosate is safe. But it has stopped using the ingredient in its residential version of Roundup and has set aside $16 billion to settle cases. It continues to use glyphosate in its agricultural version of Roundup but has warned that it might have to stop doing so if the legal costs keep mounting.

Doesn't sound like it's safe to me.
We don't need to be giving giant companies shields like that. We also don't need a jury deciding what causes cancer when the scientific results aren't there.

Bayer is the beneficiary. Bayer is not a farmer. 

> The new law “demonstrates that Georgia stands with its farmers, who work tirelessly to produce safe and affordable food,” said Brian Naber, president of Bayer’s crop sciences in North America, Australia and New Zealand.

In the landscaping business we thought we knew that when Roundup was banned in France, the bees came back.  But when I went to go look that up all I could find was clouds and clouds of professionally planted disinformation.

So I still believe it.
Idgaf about any link to cancer. I'm significantly more concerned about the ecological impacts. Pollinators > people.

Why is everybody freaking out over unsubstantiated dubious cancer claims rather than the widespread ecosystem damage that's well known and understood? Like if you're going to hate it please learn to hate it for the right reasons.

I have been reading studies on this.  Humans don't have the chemical pathway to be directly poisoned by glycophate, however these studies seem to indicate that glycophate does directly kill much of the microflora in the intestines disrupting many of the metabolic functions in the gut.  This in turn has links to forms of cancer and autoimmune diseases.

Medicine has barely touched on microbiome research, but I'm betting this is the source of the issue.  There are low doses of glycophate throughout much of our food supply.

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4047521/

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9145961/

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1382668923000911

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9321451/

Georgia is also the state where prosecutors have absolute immunity. If they lie or break the law to convict you, they face no consequences whatsoever and cannot be sued for their misconduct. I feel terrible for people stuck there with MTG
A Republican Government for the Corporation, Lobbied by the Corporation, and against all non-millionaire people.

It never ends with this twat

He did the same thing in his first term then never followed up on it. He also removed a Biden-era law that restricted insulin prices to $30, so he literally raised prices and is now acting like he’s saving us by lowering them back to Biden-era prices
“Man who turned off the overhead lights announces plan to light a candle soon.”
Didn’t he claim he was going to do this his first term too?
He should tariff them at 125% then lower it to 10%, then declare it a “total reset” and success, and hope nobody notices it is 10% higher than before.

Executive orders require money to come from the executive branch for them to be enforced.  If dummy says a thing and then doesn't fund it, then he did nothing.  Alas, his idiot cult members don't know shit, so they'll listen when he lies that big pharma isn't heeding his EO.

Trump:  They will bring the prices down or I will add tariffs!

Drug Co:  you mean we can raise prices more and blame the tariffs?  Count us in!

posts.title: Trump fires director of U.S. Copyright Office, sources say
top_comments:
"...Perlmutter's firing was "a brazen, unprecedented power grab with no legal basis.... surely no coincidence he acted less than a day after she refused to rubber-stamp Elon Musk's efforts to mine troves of copyrighted works to train AI models," in reference to the report released by the Copyright Office this week.  

Last month, Musk took to his social media platform X to seemingly express support for the abolition of intellectual property laws..."

He sure is firing people left and right. Is there a website that tracks all the government heads that are being fired? I know I posted earlier that he fired the Librarian for Congress Friday. [https://federalnewsnetwork.com/workforce/2025/05/president-donald-trump-fires-librarian-of-congress-carla-hayden/](https://federalnewsnetwork.com/workforce/2025/05/president-donald-trump-fires-librarian-of-congress-carla-hayden/)

Edit: Added another name and more details who has been fired..Earlier Thursday, the [acting administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency](https://apnews.com/article/fema-trump-administrator-replaced-emergency-b9ae5e6a7e1c09e51de99c5148f45eb2) was pushed out one day after he had testified that he did not agree with proposals to dismantle the organization. Trump has suggested that individual states, not FEMA, should take the lead on responding to hurricanes, tornadoes and other crises.

At the Pentagon, more than a half-dozen [top general officers have been fired](https://apnews.com/article/trump-brown-joint-chiefs-of-staff-firing-fa428cc1508a583b3bf5e7a5a58f6acf) since January, including the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Gen. CQ Brown Jr. The only two women serving as four-star officers, as well as a disproportionate number of other senior female officers, have also been fired.
We all know the intellectual property laws are only going to be suspended for the rich and corporations
We're cooked.  Elon can just steal whatever he wants now
Damn I was half joking when I said this office was going to be fired for denying Elons copyright claims and it happens less than a week later. This is going into banana republic levels of corruption.
Strikes me as an admission that Elon's underlings weren't skilled enough to steal copyrighted work like every other major AI company does.
Wasn’t this the issue that started the first Trade War with China?
Trump, gutting US civilization.
Musk had to stop the director’s report that his xAI training is copyright infringement.

Y'know...ordinarily, if an administration does its job well enough to keep a government by of and for the people running properly, I can tolerate ideological differences within reason. But you have to do a good job first. You have to preserve the system of people-run governance. You have to maintain the integrity of the Constitution--not just in word, but in spirit. You have to keep the ship running and in, more or less, the right direction. 

  
But what I can't tolerate, is what *this* administration is doing. It has nothing to do with ideology. This is a recklessly harmful thing to do and I wish someone within this administration had the courage and sense enough to recommend against acts like these. Putting an ill-suited, inexperienced crony loyalist in charge of the copyright office is a ruinously dumb headed thing to do. And it speaks ill of the administration's competency and utter disregard for practical or moral consideration in restraining the chief executive's impulsive desire for revenge against every person and every institution which already *has* made America great.



It is simply wrong to do.

posts.title: 'Children handcuffed and shot' - ex-UK Special Forces break silence on war crime claims
top_comments:
"Former members of UK Special Forces have broken years of silence to give BBC Panorama eyewitness accounts of alleged war crimes committed by colleagues in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Giving their accounts publicly for the first time, the veterans described seeing members of the SAS murder unarmed people in their sleep and execute handcuffed detainees, including children.

"They handcuffed a young boy and shot him," recalled one veteran who served with the SAS in Afghanistan. "He was clearly a child, not even close to fighting age."

Killing of detainees "became routine", the veteran said. "They'd search someone, handcuff them, then shoot them", before cutting off the plastic handcuffs used to restrain people and "planting a pistol" by the body, he said.

...

Knowledge of the alleged crimes was not confined to small teams or individual squadrons, according to the testimony. Within the UK Special Forces command structure, "everyone knew" what was happening, said one veteran.

...

"There was a fake grenade they'd take with them onto target, it couldn't detonate," said a former SAS operator. Another veteran said operators would carry AK-47 rifles which had a folding stock because they were easier to fit into their rucksacks and "easier to bring onto a target and plant by a body".

Officers would then help to falsify post-operational reports in order to avoid scrutiny for the actions of assault teams on the ground, according to the testimony.

...

"If it looked like a shooting could represent a breach of the rules of conflict, you'd get a phone call from the legal adviser or one of the staff officers in HQ. They'd pick you up on it and help you to clarify the language. 'Do you remember someone making a sudden move?' 'Oh yeah, I do now.' That sort of thing. It was built into the way we operated."

The reports were "a fiction", another UKSF veteran said.

An intelligence officer who worked with the SBS described reports which said they had been caught in a firefight, while the photos showed bodies with "multiple clean headshots".

...

The Afghan president was "so consistent with his complaints about night raids, civilian casualties and detentions that there was no senior Western diplomat or military leader who would have missed the fact that this was a major irritant for him," said Gen Douglas Lute, a former US ambassador to Nato.

..."

We are outraged when Russian troops do stuff like this, and rightly so. We should be similarly outraged when friendly forces do such things. This wasn’t a small bunch of soldiers going rogue, this was an institutionalised disregard for the ethics of warfare and established military protocol.

This is horrifying. All these people should be brought to justice. No whitewashing for european armies if they behave like bloodthirsty monster on the field. 

An army that behaves like a mad beast should be restrained and reformed and the leaders that allowed it should be imprisoned and be made to paid for their complicity if not outright orders to do this. For all the supposed "responsibilities" of command that justifiers their higher salaries and benefits, they don't seem to accept the consequences of their failed leadership when the chickens come home to roost.

At this point, we should all understand that these kinds of things will be happening any time we're sending people into these sorts of situations. War makes monsters of people, or at least lets monsters thrive. Is whatever we're doing with those boots on the ground worth that price?

[SAS unit repeatedly killed Afghan detainees, BBC finds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-62083196)

And 'The Overseas Operations Bill' gives them immunity.
Remember that whole late 2000s early 2010s period of media glazing special forces as super soldiers and then it turns out they're just a bunch of sociopaths who failed to achieve anything

It was a blatant and abhorrent invasion from day one:

1. The sorry excuse of WMD to invade a foreign country by a set of countries playing games for their own personal gains.
2. Studies say that around 0.5 Million people died due to the invasion and many more injured.
3. Not to mention the damage to the infrastructure, political structures and the economic impact on the country invaded.

The media is complicit in all of this as the coverage was shameful to say the least. They have parroted the official propagandized versions for so long. The UN, for what its worth did not authorize the invasion.

Did any of the true decision makers face the law due to this? Is there any guilt shown at the very least? Did some of them line-up their own pockets throughout this ordeal?

This will answer why massive "mistakes" of this ilk are being repeated at an alarming frequency.

Sources:

[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-24547256](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-24547256)

[https://watson.brown.edu/costsofwar/costs/human/civilians](https://watson.brown.edu/costsofwar/costs/human/civilians)
Wondered why Boris was so keen to get immunity from war crimes for the armed forces. It was a weird thing to campaign on if one's hands were clean.
As humans our capacity for inhumane violence is impressive and 100% depressing.

Maybe the guys whose entire careers revolve around dehumanization and killing aren’t great people on the inside regardless of which flag patch is on their arm. The more SF guys talk about SF life, the clearer it becomes that these types are school shooters who managed to keep a lid on it for a while.

The plan all along was to hurt the American public so badly with 165% tariffs that we would meekly accept and be grateful for a 30% tariff-MAKE NO MISTAKE, this is the biggest TAX INCREASE in American history and this money is directly controlled by Trump, NOT CONGRESS, which is the ONLY branch of government allowed to levy taxes and control the budget under the Constitution.

Oh fantastic, So instead of empty shelves just  in June and July. We'll have more empty shelves in fall or winter

posts.title: Convicted killer falls to death from Milan's famed Duomo cathedral after allegedly stabbing man, reports say
top_comments:
> One witness, a bar owner named Emanuele Sanità, told the outlet that De Maria landed right next to a boy who was holding a stuffed animal.

> "He fell next to him. He was in shock. He sat there for twenty minutes without speaking," Sanità said

Hope they get that kid some therapy.

From CBS:

>A convicted murderer permitted to work outside prison threw himself from Milan's famed Duomo cathedral on Sunday, killing himself, after allegedly stabbing a colleague, local news reports said.

>[ANSA news agency](https://www.ansa.it/lombardia/notizie/2025/05/11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-dal-duomo-di-milano_4b25c690-d646-44f6-8dfd-c02d80d364ec.html) and other outlets reported said the Italian man, whom they identified as Emanuele De Maria, 35, fell "dozens of meters" after reportedly throwing himself from the Gothic cathedral into the square below.

>The area surrounding the Duomo, Milan's most famed landmark, is usually teeming with people but news reports did not cite any injuries among passersby.

>Television images showed police blocking off the area surrounding one of the sides of the cathedral.

>Authorities identified De Maria — who went on television last year to describe his life — from an ID in his pocket and his tattoos, according to several reports, including Milan's [Corriere della Sera daily](https://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/25_maggio_11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-in-piazza-duomo-i-testimoni-si-e-buttato-tra-la-folla-cadendo-ha-sfiorato-un-ragazzino-e-poteva-5ced10e4-ab7c-4950-8d0a-8176428efxlk.shtml).

>One witness, a bar owner named Emanuele Sanità, [told the outlet](https://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/25_maggio_11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-in-piazza-duomo-i-testimoni-si-e-buttato-tra-la-folla-cadendo-ha-sfiorato-un-ragazzino-e-poteva-5ced10e4-ab7c-4950-8d0a-8176428efxlk.shtml) that De Maria landed right next to a boy who was holding a stuffed animal.

>"He fell next to him. He was in shock. He sat there for twenty minutes without speaking," Sanità said.

>De Maria had been serving a 14-year sentence after being convicted for the 2016 murder of a woman, according to reports. He was arrested in Germany in 2018 after hiding as a fugitive in the Netherlands, Milano Today [reported](https://www.milanotoday.it/cronaca/emanuele-de-maria-suicidio-duomo.html).

>But for nearly two years he had been working part-time at a hotel near Milan's central train station.

>Police had been searching for him since Friday, when he allegedly stabbed a work colleague. The condition of that man, identified as a 50-year-old Italian-Egyptian, was improving Sunday after emergency surgery on his neck and chest, Milano Today reported.
I hope the kid that was close get some mental health check.
Did he miss the haystack?
Agatha Christie says everyone took turns pushing him
JFC. This sounds like a weird tragic Italian opera.

Murder who went on the run and was found in the Netherlands was allowed to work outside prison. 

Insanity.
Letting a convicted murderer (who seemed to still be serving his sentence?) work in a hotel is a major yikes.
I was in 9/11 and absolutely know the knowledge of what happens to a body when it hits the ground stays with you.....
I swear I've seen this movie

posts.title: Top UK Special Forces general oversaw blocking of Afghan 'war-crime' witnesses to Britain
top_comments:
"...

Thousands of applications from individuals with credible evidence of service with Afghan Special Forces, including the units known as the Triples, were then rejected, leaving many of the former commandos at the mercy of the Taliban.

...

If the Afghan commandos were in the UK, they could be called as witnesses - but the inquiry has no power to compel testimony from foreign nationals who are overseas.

Some of those denied visas were subsequently tortured and killed by the Taliban, according to former colleagues, family members and lawyer.

...

Panorama has now heard eyewitness testimony from veterans who served in UK Special Forces detailing alleged war crimes stretching over more than a decade and involving the SBS as well as the SAS.

 ...

Asked by Panorama about the government's rejection of Triples' applications, Bruce Houlder KC, who as a former director of service prosecutions was responsible for bringing charges against members of the armed forces, said the government must have known the Triples would have "highly relevant" evidence that would be "much easier to obtain" if they were in the UK.

..."

posts.title: Georgia become second US state to shield maker of Roundup weed killer from some cancer claims
top_comments: FYI, the other state is North Dakota

>Bayer insists glyphosate is safe. But it has stopped using the ingredient in its residential version of Roundup and has set aside $16 billion to settle cases. It continues to use glyphosate in its agricultural version of Roundup but has warned that it might have to stop doing so if the legal costs keep mounting.

Doesn't sound like it's safe to me.
We don't need to be giving giant companies shields like that. We also don't need a jury deciding what causes cancer when the scientific results aren't there.

Bayer is the beneficiary. Bayer is not a farmer. 

> The new law “demonstrates that Georgia stands with its farmers, who work tirelessly to produce safe and affordable food,” said Brian Naber, president of Bayer’s crop sciences in North America, Australia and New Zealand.

In the landscaping business we thought we knew that when Roundup was banned in France, the bees came back.  But when I went to go look that up all I could find was clouds and clouds of professionally planted disinformation.

So I still believe it.
Idgaf about any link to cancer. I'm significantly more concerned about the ecological impacts. Pollinators > people.

Why is everybody freaking out over unsubstantiated dubious cancer claims rather than the widespread ecosystem damage that's well known and understood? Like if you're going to hate it please learn to hate it for the right reasons.

I have been reading studies on this.  Humans don't have the chemical pathway to be directly poisoned by glycophate, however these studies seem to indicate that glycophate does directly kill much of the microflora in the intestines disrupting many of the metabolic functions in the gut.  This in turn has links to forms of cancer and autoimmune diseases.

Medicine has barely touched on microbiome research, but I'm betting this is the source of the issue.  There are low doses of glycophate throughout much of our food supply.

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4047521/

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9145961/

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1382668923000911

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9321451/

Georgia is also the state where prosecutors have absolute immunity. If they lie or break the law to convict you, they face no consequences whatsoever and cannot be sued for their misconduct. I feel terrible for people stuck there with MTG
A Republican Government for the Corporation, Lobbied by the Corporation, and against all non-millionaire people.

posts.title: Nissan to cut over 10,000 more jobs, NHK reports
top_comments:
Well shit, wish I saw this coming…

“TOKYO, May 12 (Reuters) - Nissan Motor (7201.T) will cut more than 10,000 jobs globally, bringing the number of layoffs, including those previously announced, to about 20,000 or 15% of its workforce, Japan's public broadcaster NHK reported on Monday. Japan's third-biggest automaker is striving to make its business leaner and more resilient after weak sales in China and its biggest market the United States.

Nissan declined to comment on the report.

It is set to announce on Tuesday results for the business year that ended in March. It warned last month it would likely book a record 700 billion yen to 750 billion yen ($4.74 billion-$5.08 billion) net loss in that year due to impairment charges. The car maker missed out on the growing popularity of hybrid models in the United States and failed to capitalise on an early lead in electric vehicles there.

It has also suffered in China, the world's biggest auto market, where it plans to launch some 10 new vehicles in the coming years to try to halt a slide in sales. CEO Ivan Espinosa, who took over from Makoto Uchida as chief executive last month, is restructuring Nissan's operations and has previously said the company was considering extra measures. Nissan, which had more than 133,000 staff as of March last year, announced plans last November to cut 9,000 jobs and reduce global capacity by 20%. Advertisement · Scroll to continue It has also said it would close a plant in Thailand by June and shut two more plants that it has not identified.

On Friday, it said it had decided to give up a plan to build a $1.1 billion factory, for which it was set to receive government subsidies, for EV batteries on Japan's southwestern island of Kyushu. Its weak performance forced it to cut its profit outlook four times for the financial year that just ended.”
Wild that they declined to merge with Honda because they wanted to be an equal brand.   What is Nissan leadership?
My brother works for Nissan and is expecting his first kid.. this makes me nervous for him
How are these guys still in business this is the slowest business collapse that I can remember.
I predict Nissan stocks dumping.
[deleted]

There's been rumor for a while that they're looking at selling to Honda.  After Renault got out of the deal with Nissan and Mitsubishi, Nissan has been hurting. The problem with Nissan has been that they do not make any vehicles (save for maybe the Z) that differentiate themselves from any other vehicles on the market.
I’m in an Asian dominant area. No one here drives Nissan. It’s not a good sign already
Nissan higher-ups cared only for their independence and refused merger that might have saved their company.  In their arrogance they burned the bridge and now the chicken have come to roost.

posts.title: Convicted killer falls to death from Milan's famed Duomo cathedral after allegedly stabbing man, reports say
top_comments:
> One witness, a bar owner named Emanuele Sanità, told the outlet that De Maria landed right next to a boy who was holding a stuffed animal.

> "He fell next to him. He was in shock. He sat there for twenty minutes without speaking," Sanità said

Hope they get that kid some therapy.

From CBS:

>A convicted murderer permitted to work outside prison threw himself from Milan's famed Duomo cathedral on Sunday, killing himself, after allegedly stabbing a colleague, local news reports said.

>[ANSA news agency](https://www.ansa.it/lombardia/notizie/2025/05/11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-dal-duomo-di-milano_4b25c690-d646-44f6-8dfd-c02d80d364ec.html) and other outlets reported said the Italian man, whom they identified as Emanuele De Maria, 35, fell "dozens of meters" after reportedly throwing himself from the Gothic cathedral into the square below.

>The area surrounding the Duomo, Milan's most famed landmark, is usually teeming with people but news reports did not cite any injuries among passersby.

>Television images showed police blocking off the area surrounding one of the sides of the cathedral.

>Authorities identified De Maria — who went on television last year to describe his life — from an ID in his pocket and his tattoos, according to several reports, including Milan's [Corriere della Sera daily](https://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/25_maggio_11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-in-piazza-duomo-i-testimoni-si-e-buttato-tra-la-folla-cadendo-ha-sfiorato-un-ragazzino-e-poteva-5ced10e4-ab7c-4950-8d0a-8176428efxlk.shtml).

>One witness, a bar owner named Emanuele Sanità, [told the outlet](https://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/25_maggio_11/emanuele-de-maria-suicida-in-piazza-duomo-i-testimoni-si-e-buttato-tra-la-folla-cadendo-ha-sfiorato-un-ragazzino-e-poteva-5ced10e4-ab7c-4950-8d0a-8176428efxlk.shtml) that De Maria landed right next to a boy who was holding a stuffed animal.

>"He fell next to him. He was in shock. He sat there for twenty minutes without speaking," Sanità said.

>De Maria had been serving a 14-year sentence after being convicted for the 2016 murder of a woman, according to reports. He was arrested in Germany in 2018 after hiding as a fugitive in the Netherlands, Milano Today [reported](https://www.milanotoday.it/cronaca/emanuele-de-maria-suicidio-duomo.html).

>But for nearly two years he had been working part-time at a hotel near Milan's central train station.

>Police had been searching for him since Friday, when he allegedly stabbed a work colleague. The condition of that man, identified as a 50-year-old Italian-Egyptian, was improving Sunday after emergency surgery on his neck and chest, Milano Today reported.
I hope the kid that was close get some mental health check.
Did he miss the haystack?
Agatha Christie says everyone took turns pushing him
JFC. This sounds like a weird tragic Italian opera.

Murder who went on the run and was found in the Netherlands was allowed to work outside prison. 

Insanity.
Letting a convicted murderer (who seemed to still be serving his sentence?) work in a hotel is a major yikes.
I was in 9/11 and absolutely know the knowledge of what happens to a body when it hits the ground stays with you.....
I swear I've seen this movie

posts.title: Georgia become second US state to shield maker of Roundup weed killer from some cancer claims
top_comments: FYI, the other state is North Dakota

>Bayer insists glyphosate is safe. But it has stopped using the ingredient in its residential version of Roundup and has set aside $16 billion to settle cases. It continues to use glyphosate in its agricultural version of Roundup but has warned that it might have to stop doing so if the legal costs keep mounting.

Doesn't sound like it's safe to me.
We don't need to be giving giant companies shields like that. We also don't need a jury deciding what causes cancer when the scientific results aren't there.

Bayer is the beneficiary. Bayer is not a farmer. 

> The new law “demonstrates that Georgia stands with its farmers, who work tirelessly to produce safe and affordable food,” said Brian Naber, president of Bayer’s crop sciences in North America, Australia and New Zealand.

In the landscaping business we thought we knew that when Roundup was banned in France, the bees came back.  But when I went to go look that up all I could find was clouds and clouds of professionally planted disinformation.

So I still believe it.
Idgaf about any link to cancer. I'm significantly more concerned about the ecological impacts. Pollinators > people.

Why is everybody freaking out over unsubstantiated dubious cancer claims rather than the widespread ecosystem damage that's well known and understood? Like if you're going to hate it please learn to hate it for the right reasons.

I have been reading studies on this.  Humans don't have the chemical pathway to be directly poisoned by glycophate, however these studies seem to indicate that glycophate does directly kill much of the microflora in the intestines disrupting many of the metabolic functions in the gut.  This in turn has links to forms of cancer and autoimmune diseases.

Medicine has barely touched on microbiome research, but I'm betting this is the source of the issue.  There are low doses of glycophate throughout much of our food supply.

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4047521/

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9145961/

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1382668923000911

https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9321451/

Georgia is also the state where prosecutors have absolute immunity. If they lie or break the law to convict you, they face no consequences whatsoever and cannot be sued for their misconduct. I feel terrible for people stuck there with MTG
A Republican Government for the Corporation, Lobbied by the Corporation, and against all non-millionaire people.

Wow, great job everyone. You caught him! Resources well spent. Another violent criminal off the streets.

Prostitution is a human inevitability. The concept is a constant throughout human history and developed in multiple, separate, and exclusive civilizations. 

It will never stop. It will never go away. 

Legalize it and allow these individuals to be treated like any other business. Cut the shit.

Doesn't sound like anything worth taxpayer money or publication. Only unfortunate detail:

And one I'm ambivalent about:
 
> Snyder also holds a summer camp at Messiah University -- a private Christian School in Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania. The camp is slated to be held June 20-23.

Thank goodness this dangerous criminal is off the streets. It would have been nice if the police could have spent the time and effort put into this operation catching thieves and killers, but I guess you can't have everything.

*. We’re going to be working on the fundamentals of wrestling, proper stance, proper head position, how to hand fight and dominate your opponent,” Snyder says in a video.   “And we’re also going to be talking about the Lord Jesus. That’s the most important thing, how he’s going to change our life, bring us closer to him. Looking forward to seeing you guys. God bless*.”

“Turkey secures rights to 90 percent of oil and gas output in Somalia deal”

Full article: https://nordicmonitor.com/2025/04/turkey-secures-exceptional-rights-in-somalia-oil-agreement-documents-show/
Look! I "discovered" 30 gallons of gasoline in my neighbor's car! Well, I *say* "neighbor;" he lives a few blocks down the street. Any takers?
We gonna get a sequel to Black Hawk Down soon
Who put all those barrels there???
And I'm sure the impoverished people of Somalia will be getting their share of the profits... right? Right???
US "liberation" of Somalia in 3... 2... 1...

At $66 per barrel and assuming that after extraction costs Somalia could walk away with about 15% of that, the 20B gallons would be worth about $200B.  Spread it out over \~15-20 years and they'd roughly double their GDP.
Perfect!  Because Somalia already has war, now they have the oil to ensure it continues.
This will go well for the average Somali citizen, no doubt.
Nice, Erdogan can get himself another golden toilet now.

posts.title: Residents jump from windows during Milwaukee apartment fire that kills 4
top_comments: Sprinkler systems save lives, period.

From AP:

>MILWAUKEE — Residents jumped from the windows of a four-story apartment building in Milwaukee during a Mother’s Day fire that killed four people, critically injured four others and grew so intense that the blaze outmatched the first firefighters to arrive, authorities said.

>Ladder trucks were used to rescue other residents from windows while some firefighters inside the burning building crawled on hands and knees to get people out, Milwaukee Fire Chief Aaron Lipski said Sunday. In all, about 30 people were rescued.

>Authorities have not said how the fire might have started.

>Lipski said the building did not have a sprinkler system and was built in 1968, predating a law that would have required one, according to the fire chief.

>“If we had sprinklers in the buidling we would have stopped the fire very, very small. We would not of had to have people jumping out of windows,” he said.

>Several other residents were treated for lesser injuries in the fire that began sometime before 8 a.m. The blaze rendered the 85-unit building uninhabitable, displacing an estimated 200 people.

>James Rubinstein, a resident in the building, said he jumped to the ground floor.

>“There was so much smoke. I climbed out the courtyard with my cat in my backpack,” Rubinstein told television station FOX6 Milwaukee.

>Emergency operaters received calls that people were trapped and jumping to escape. The first firefighters to arrive were “far, far outmatched” by intense flames, Lipski said.

>Authorities did not immediately release the identities or ages of the victims. Lipski said the fire began in a common area and spread to multiple floors.

>Eddie Edwards, another resident of the building, said he also jumped to escape.

>“I wasn’t thinking about nothing but getting away,” he told Milwaukee television station WISN. “Getting out and saving everyone’s life. It was a scary moment.”

A fifth person has died from their injuries as of this morning 😞 https://www.tmj4.com/news/milwaukee-county/milwaukee-county-medical-examiner-called-to-the-scene-of-fatal-fire-near-27th-and-highland?fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAR57uRCsSu-6f60g35bCe7KrFo-pcHGfyz6hScsm5b49zGK48GcmkF46Pyl_Dw_aem_vT_wUyIFy88-QNypGepi1Q
A reminder that you can buy emergency fire escape ladders if you are concerned about being able to escape from an upper floor.

> We would **not of had** to have people jumping out of windows,” he said.

Great job NBC news
There’s an update that arson is suspected.
